comments:
Moving a text file from a folder to another in FTP connection throws NPE.

To reproduce:
1. Setup an FTP server on an XP machine.
2. Connect to this machine from a Vista machine using RSE
      Bring up New Connection Dialog, Select Windows, Next
      Type Host name, Next, Select ftp, Finish.
3. Try to move a text file from one directory to another in the FTP connection.
      Now NPE is thrown.

I also tried selecting FTP (instead of Windows in step 2 above) and same problem occurs.

Here are the log contents...

Dave, master of adapters, can you look at this?

I've tried this with non-windows ftp connections but I couldn't reproduce this.  I added a null point check to avoid the exception that you hit although that may just be pushing the problem elsewhere (not sure why there wouldn't be an adapter).  Have you been able to reproduce this with unix FTP connections?
I tried this using an ftp to a linux machine and ftp to a win2k3 machine.  On both I got the NPE.
If you use the lastest source from CVS do you still see this problem?
Using the latest source from CVS and ftp connecting to a linux machine I no longer get the NPE.
This is fixed so I'm marking it as fixed.
